(General) Linear Models Report

Source: R/report.lm.R, R/report.lme4.R
report.lm.Rd

Create a report for (general) linear models.

# S3 method for lm
report(x, include_effectsize = TRUE, effectsize_method = "refit", ...)

# S3 method for lm
report_effectsize(x, effectsize_method = "refit", ...)

# S3 method for lm
report_table(x, include_effectsize = TRUE, ...)

# S3 method for lm
report_statistics(
  x,
  table = NULL,
  include_effectsize = TRUE,
  include_diagnostic = TRUE,
  ...
)

# S3 method for lm
report_parameters(
  x,
  table = NULL,
  include_effectsize = TRUE,
  include_intercept = TRUE,
  ...
)

# S3 method for lm
report_intercept(x, table = NULL, ...)

# S3 method for lm
report_model(x, table = NULL, ...)

# S3 method for lm
report_performance(x, table = NULL, ...)

# S3 method for lm
report_info(
  x,
  effectsize = NULL,
  include_effectsize = FALSE,
  parameters = NULL,
  ...
)

# S3 method for lm
report_text(x, table = NULL, ...)

# S3 method for merMod
report_random(x, ...)

Arguments

x

Object of class lm or glm.
include_effectsize

If FALSE, won't include effect-size related indices (standardized coefficients, etc.).
effectsize_method

See documentation for effectsize::effectsize().
...

Arguments passed to or from other methods.
table

Provide the output of report_table() to avoid its re-computation.
include_diagnostic

If FALSE, won't include diagnostic related indices for Bayesian models (ESS, Rhat).
include_intercept

If FALSE, won't include the intercept.
effectsize

Provide the output of report_effectsize() to avoid its re-computation.
parameters

Provide the output of report_parameters() to avoid its re-computation.

Value

A list-object of class report, which contains further list-objects with a short and long description of the model summary, as well as a short and long table of parameters and fit indices.

See also

Specific components of reports (especially for stats models):

  • report_table

  • report_parameters

  • report_statistics

  • report_effectsize

  • report_model

  • report_random

  • report_performance

  • report_info

  • report_text

Other types of reports:

  • report_system

  • report_packages

  • report_participants

  • report_sample

Methods:

  • as.report

Examples

library(report)

# Linear models
model <- lm(Sepal.Length ~ Petal.Length * Species, data = iris)
r <- report(model)
r

#> We fitted a linear model (estimated using OLS) to predict Sepal.Length with Petal.Length and Species (formula: Sepal.Length ~ Petal.Length * Species). The model explains a significant and substantial proportion of variance (R2 = 0.84, F(5, 144) = 151.71, p < .001, adj. R2 = 0.83). The model's intercept, corresponding to Petal.Length = 0 and Species = setosa, is at 4.21 (95% CI [3.41, 5.02], t(144) = 10.34, p < .001). Within this model:
#> 
#>   - The effect of Petal.Length is non-significantly positive (beta = 0.54, 95% CI [-4.76e-03, 1.09], t(144) = 1.96, p = 0.052; Std. beta = 1.16, 95% CI [-0.01, 2.32])
#>   - The effect of Species [versicolor] is significantly negative (beta = -1.81, 95% CI [-2.99, -0.62], t(144) = -3.02, p < .01; Std. beta = -0.88, 95% CI [-2.41, 0.65])
#>   - The effect of Species [virginica] is significantly negative (beta = -3.15, 95% CI [-4.41, -1.90], t(144) = -4.97, p < .001; Std. beta = -1.75, 95% CI [-3.32, -0.18])
#>   - The interaction effect of Species [versicolor] on Petal.Length is non-significantly positive (beta = 0.29, 95% CI [-0.30, 0.87], t(144) = 0.97, p = 0.334; Std. beta = 0.61, 95% CI [-0.63, 1.85])
#>   - The interaction effect of Species [virginica] on Petal.Length is non-significantly positive (beta = 0.45, 95% CI [-0.12, 1.03], t(144) = 1.56, p = 0.120; Std. beta = 0.97, 95% CI [-0.26, 2.19])
#> 
#> Standardized parameters were obtained by fitting the model on a standardized version of the dataset.
summary(r)

#> We fitted a linear model to predict Sepal.Length with Petal.Length and Species. The model's explanatory power is substantial (R2 = 0.84, adj. R2 = 0.83). The model's intercept is at 4.21 (95% CI [3.41, 5.02]). Within this model:
#> 
#>   - The effect of Petal.Length is non-significantly positive (beta = 0.54, 95% CI [-4.76e-03, 1.09], t(144) = 1.96, p = 0.052, Std. beta = 1.16)
#>   - The effect of Species [versicolor] is significantly negative (beta = -1.81, 95% CI [-2.99, -0.62], t(144) = -3.02, p < .01, Std. beta = -0.88)
#>   - The effect of Species [virginica] is significantly negative (beta = -3.15, 95% CI [-4.41, -1.90], t(144) = -4.97, p < .001, Std. beta = -1.75)
#>   - The interaction effect of Species [versicolor] on Petal.Length is non-significantly positive (beta = 0.29, 95% CI [-0.30, 0.87], t(144) = 0.97, p = 0.334, Std. beta = 0.61)
#>   - The interaction effect of Species [virginica] on Petal.Length is non-significantly positive (beta = 0.45, 95% CI [-0.12, 1.03], t(144) = 1.56, p = 0.120, Std. beta = 0.97)
as.data.frame(r)

#> Parameter                           | Coefficient |         95% CI |     t |  df |      p | Std. Coef. | Std. Coef. 95% CI |    Fit
#> -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> (Intercept)                         |        4.21 | [ 3.41,  5.02] | 10.34 | 144 | < .001 |       0.49 |    [-1.03,  2.01] |       
#> Petal.Length                        |        0.54 | [ 0.00,  1.09] |  1.96 | 144 | 0.052  |       1.16 |    [-0.01,  2.32] |       
#> Species [versicolor]                |       -1.81 | [-2.99, -0.62] | -3.02 | 144 | 0.003  |      -0.88 |    [-2.41,  0.65] |       
#> Species [virginica]                 |       -3.15 | [-4.41, -1.90] | -4.97 | 144 | < .001 |      -1.75 |    [-3.32, -0.18] |       
#> Petal.Length * Species [versicolor] |        0.29 | [-0.30,  0.87] |  0.97 | 144 | 0.334  |       0.61 |    [-0.63,  1.85] |       
#> Petal.Length * Species [virginica]  |        0.45 | [-0.12,  1.03] |  1.56 | 144 | 0.120  |       0.97 |    [-0.26,  2.19] |       
#>                                     |             |                |       |     |        |            |                   |       
#> AIC                                 |             |                |       |     |        |            |                   | 106.77
#> BIC                                 |             |                |       |     |        |            |                   | 127.84
#> R2                                  |             |                |       |     |        |            |                   |   0.84
#> R2 (adj.)                           |             |                |       |     |        |            |                   |   0.83
#> Sigma                               |             |                |       |     |        |            |                   |   0.34
summary(as.data.frame(r))

#> Parameter                           | Coefficient |         95% CI |     t |  df |      p | Std. Coef. |  Fit
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> (Intercept)                         |        4.21 | [ 3.41,  5.02] | 10.34 | 144 | < .001 |       0.49 |     
#> Petal.Length                        |        0.54 | [ 0.00,  1.09] |  1.96 | 144 | 0.052  |       1.16 |     
#> Species [versicolor]                |       -1.81 | [-2.99, -0.62] | -3.02 | 144 | 0.003  |      -0.88 |     
#> Species [virginica]                 |       -3.15 | [-4.41, -1.90] | -4.97 | 144 | < .001 |      -1.75 |     
#> Petal.Length * Species [versicolor] |        0.29 | [-0.30,  0.87] |  0.97 | 144 | 0.334  |       0.61 |     
#> Petal.Length * Species [virginica]  |        0.45 | [-0.12,  1.03] |  1.56 | 144 | 0.120  |       0.97 |     
#>                                     |             |                |       |     |        |            |     
#> R2                                  |             |                |       |     |        |            | 0.84
#> R2 (adj.)                           |             |                |       |     |        |            | 0.83
#> Sigma                               |             |                |       |     |        |            | 0.34

# Logistic models
model <- glm(vs ~ disp, data = mtcars, family = "binomial")
r <- report(model)
r

#> We fitted a logistic model (estimated using ML) to predict vs with disp (formula: vs ~ disp). The model's explanatory power is substantial (Tjur's R2 = 0.53). The model's intercept, corresponding to disp = 0, is at 4.14 (95% CI [1.81, 7.44], p < .01). Within this model:
#> 
#>   - The effect of disp is significantly negative (beta = -0.02, 95% CI [-0.04, -0.01], p < .01; Std. beta = -2.68, 95% CI [-4.90, -1.27])
#> 
#> Standardized parameters were obtained by fitting the model on a standardized version of the dataset.
summary(r)

#> We fitted a logistic model to predict vs with disp. The model's explanatory power is substantial (Tjur's R2 = 0.53). The model's intercept is at 4.14 (95% CI [1.81, 7.44]). Within this model:
#> 
#>   - The effect of disp is significantly negative (beta = -0.02, 95% CI [-0.04, -0.01], p < .01, Std. beta = -2.68)
as.data.frame(r)

#> Parameter   | Coefficient |         95% CI |     z |     p | Std. Coef. | Std. Coef. 95% CI |   Fit
#> ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> (Intercept) |        4.14 | [ 1.81,  7.44] |  2.98 | 0.003 |      -0.85 |    [-2.42,  0.27] |      
#> disp        |       -0.02 | [-0.04, -0.01] | -3.03 | 0.002 |      -2.68 |    [-4.90, -1.27] |      
#>             |             |                |       |       |            |                   |      
#> AIC         |             |                |       |       |            |                   | 26.70
#> BIC         |             |                |       |       |            |                   | 29.63
#> Tjur's R2   |             |                |       |       |            |                   |  0.53
#> Sigma       |             |                |       |       |            |                   |  0.87
#> Log_loss    |             |                |       |       |            |                   |  0.35
summary(as.data.frame(r))

#> Parameter   | Coefficient |         95% CI |     z |     p | Std. Coef. |  Fit
#> ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> (Intercept) |        4.14 | [ 1.81,  7.44] |  2.98 | 0.003 |      -0.85 |     
#> disp        |       -0.02 | [-0.04, -0.01] | -3.03 | 0.002 |      -2.68 |     
#>             |             |                |       |       |            |     
#> Tjur's R2   |             |                |       |       |            | 0.53
#> Sigma       |             |                |       |       |            | 0.87
#> Log_loss    |             |                |       |       |            | 0.35

# Mixed models
if(require("lme4")){
  model <- lme4::lmer(Sepal.Length ~ Petal.Length + (1 | Species), data = iris)
  r <- report(model)
  r
  summary(r)
  as.data.frame(r)
  summary(as.data.frame(r))
}

#> Parameter        | Coefficient |       95% CI |     t |  df |      p | Std. Coef. |  Fit
#> ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> (Intercept)      |        2.50 | [1.20, 3.81] |  3.75 | 146 | < .001 |  -1.46e-13 |     
#> Petal.Length     |        0.89 | [0.76, 1.01] | 13.93 | 146 | < .001 |       1.89 |     
#>                  |             |              |       |     |        |            |     
#> R2 (conditional) |             |              |       |     |        |            | 0.97
#> R2 (marginal)    |             |              |       |     |        |            | 0.66
#> Sigma            |             |              |       |     |        |            | 0.34
